text.section:
In this section, "aggrieved person" means:
A person that:
Is a party to a dispute that the Authority resolves under § 13-1108(4)(ii) of this subtitle; and
Is aggrieved by the Authority's final action in resolving the dispute under § 13-1108(4)(ii) of this subtitle; or
The local jurisdictions within a certified heritage area from which the Authority has withdrawn approval of a management plan under § 13-1111(p) of this subtitle.

This section does not apply to:
The failure of the Authority to designate:
A heritage area as a recognized heritage area; or
A recognized heritage area as a certified heritage area through the approval of a management plan;
Actions taken by the Authority under its powers to issue bonds under Part IV of this subtitle; or
The failure of the Authority to award or enforce the terms of grants, loans, or other financing.
An aggrieved person may appeal to the Office of Administrative Hearings for a hearing in accordance with Title 10, Subtitle 2 of the State Government Article.
The decision of the Office of Administrative Hearings is the final administrative decision.

The Office of Administrative Hearings may not modify the Authority's resolution of a dispute unless the aggrieved person shows by a preponderance of the evidence that:
The final action of the Authority was arbitrary or capricious; or
The Authority failed to follow its own procedures or regulations for resolving a dispute under § 13-1108(4)(ii) of this subtitle.
